project.scrape package¶

Submodules¶

project.scrape.occupations module¶

class project.scrape.occupations.Occupations(path='../data/occupations.txt', headers=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class used to read text file containing all O*Net code and occupation titles.

occupations()[source]¶

Return all occupations found.

occupations : list
List with occupations, each row contain array with occupation info.
project.scrape.occupations.occupations()[source]¶

Helper to fetch all occupations.

project.scrape.scraper module¶

class project.scrape.scraper.JobPage(url, occupation, job_id)[source]¶

Bases: project.scrape.scraper.Page

Class to represent Job Detail Page (JDP).

This class will scrape an indivual JDP.

url : string
JDP url.
occupation : string
O*Net code for current JDP.
job_id : string
Job reference number, to prevent download duplicated jobs.
broad_occupation¶

fourth and fifth digits represent the broad occupation

clean_content(html)[source]¶
directory¶

Directory divided by onet major

file_name¶

Filename to store parsed page

file_path¶

Full path to store file

html¶

HTML read from page

major¶

first two digits of the SOC code represent the major group;

minor¶

third digit represents the minor group

onet¶

Each item in the SOC is designated by a six-digit code. The hyphen between the second and third digit is used only for clarity

parse()[source]¶

Parse HTML to remove tags like head, script, link, meta

save()[source]¶
source¶

Convert source code into BeautifulSoup object.

Removing some html tags that shouldn’t give us useful information.

class project.scrape.scraper.Page(url)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base page class, to fetch html code from given url.

url: string
URL of page to scrape.
content¶

Return page object content.

fetch()[source]¶

Execute HTML request over url and fetch source code.

self

parse()[source]¶

Base parse method, to be override by child classes.

class project.scrape.scraper.ResultsPage(occupation, title, per_page=500)[source]¶

Bases: project.scrape.scraper.Page

This class will represent a results page.

This will be the enter point to start our scraping, we will perform a search request and will lead us to this results page.

next()[source]¶

Calling next over a ResultsPage will move to next page of results an parse it.

parse()[source]¶

Parse results page.

run()[source]¶

Run search

class project.scrape.scraper.Scraper(code, title)[source]¶

Bases: object

Scraper main class.

Used to scrape job board pages, we need to fetch job detail pages to create our database to solve the O*Net classification problem.

We need to search by specific category using careeronstop.org site.

code : string
O*Net code of the category to scrape require to perform the search.
title : string
Category title required to perform the search.
fetch()[source]¶

Create new Scraper object and call run on it.

static run()[source]¶

Run scraper on each of the categories.

project.scrape.scraper.main()[source]¶

Module contents¶
